roleset.name: to cause to become quiet
roleset.note: QUIETEN-V NOTES: Frames file for 'quieten' based on internet usage examples, expansion via VN. VerbNet entry 45.4. Comparison with 'quiet.' (from quieten.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: To come here and *-1 quieten the crowd was the first thing I-1 wanted to do - and I thought we did that very professionally.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: If he'd just quieten for a moment, we'd be finished up in no time and he'd get his milk.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Never the less, the room did quieten down to catch the groovy lyrics.

roleset.name: to cause to become quiet
roleset.note: QUIET-V NOTES: Frames file for 'quiet' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from quiet.01-v predicate notes)

example.name: all arguments
example.text: In a sign [0] the stock slump has n't quieted Europe 's takeover fever , Cie . Financiere de Paribas said [0]it intends [*-1] to bid for one of France 's other large financial and industrial holding companies , Cie. de Navigation Mixte .

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Activity quieted in the New York City bond market , where heavy investor selling last week drove yields on the issuer 's full faith and credit backed bonds up as much as 0.50 percentage point [*T*-1] .
example.arg: in the New York City bond market , where heavy investor selling last week drove yields on the issuer 's full faith and credit backed bonds up as much as 0.50 percentage point [*T*-1]

example.name: all arguments
example.text: She is been quiet about her problem.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: Power is back on , and [UCSF medical center]-1 seems [*-1]to have quieted down for the night ( they were doing triage out in the parking lot from the sound and lights of it ) .
